title: Wound Manager
description: This application was created for health professionals who provide wound care. It aims to improve treatment plan consistency as well as providing guidance for treatment plans.

title: Employee Directory
description: This was my first application created after learning how to create websites using React.js and it allowed me to develop an understanding of the basic fundamentals of React. The application presents a list of employees which can be sorted or filtered by a criteria of the user's choice.

title: Google Book Search
description: This full stack application was created using the MERN stack coupled with Google Books API and allows the user to search for books and save them to a list of 'Saved Books'. Creating this application allowed me to develop a better understanding of working with this particular tech stack.

title: Eat-Da-Burger
description: This full-stack website has been deployed on Heroku and was created to demonstrate the ability to create a full stack website using Handlebars.js and MySQL. The user may add a burger to a list of burgers they wish to consume or have already consumed.

title: Employee Tracker
description: This application was created for the user to keep track of employees and manage roles/departments in their company through CLI.

title: Coding Quiz
description: This project was created shortly after learning Javascript and features a coding quiz in which the user can answer questions and keep track of their results.

title: Random Password Generator
description: This activity was completed after I first learnt how to write code using Vanilla Javascript and as a beginner, it allowed me to develop an understanding of the fundamentals and logic behind it. With this application, the user is able to generate a random password after answering a series of prompts about the criteria.

title: Daily Planner
description: This application was created to be used to organise daily work tasks during business hours. Technologies used to create this application include Local Storage, Jquery, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap and Moment.js The local storage is used to save data entered into the planner by the user. With Moment.js, entries are added with a time stamp to ensure information is displayed for the current day

title: Weather Dashboard
description: This application allows the user to view the current weather and a 5 day forecast for their chosen city and keep track of search history. The information is retreived from 'OpenWeatherMap API' using JQuery AJAX methods. User search history is saved on Local Storage.

title: Project: Open Book Project
description: This project was created as part of a group assignment demonstrating the use of two server-side API's. Using Google Sheets API and Google Books API, we created an online book sharing app which can be used by multiple users to borrow and lend books. The project was created using HTML, JQuery and Semantic UI as the CSS framework.

title: Online Ordering System
description: This full-stack web application was created in a group project to demonstrate the use of node.js, MySQL and express.js. Bulma was used as the CSS framework. With the use of Zomato API as a third party API, we created an application in which the user can search for restaurants in their city to order food from.
